etymology.description: Pictogram: three mountain peaks; in oracle-bone script drawn as triangles rather than vertical strokes; compare 丘 (qiū, mound).
etymology.interpretation: Three peaks rising side by side depict a mountain range, giving a direct visual of rugged terrain. Early triangular forms were later regularized into the three-stroke shape used today. Common in compounds like 山脉 (shānmài, mountain range) and related to terms such as 岳 (yuè, high mountain).

examples.chinese: 我们去爬山(我們去爬山)。
那座山很高(那座山很高)。
这条山路很危险(這條山路很危險)，小心点(小心點)。
examples.pinyin: Zhè tiáo shānlù hěn wēixiǎn, xiǎoxīn diǎn.
examples.english: This mountain path is dangerous; be careful.
